hackWRF 0.4.7
  • Reference

Get latitude and longitude.

Source: R/latlon.R
latlon.Rd

Get latitude and longitude.

latlon(data, coord = "BR-AQ", proj = "+proj=longlat", verbose = T)

Arguments

data

data.frame with row.names of correscponding locations

coord

data.frame or 'BR-AQ','BR-METAR','BR-INMET' containing lat, lon and row.names of each location

proj

projection string to CRS / proj4string (sp package), defoult in "+proj=longlat"

verbose

to display additional information

Examples

sample <- read.stat(paste0(system.file("extdata", package = "hackWRF"),
                           "/sample.csv"),verbose=TRUE)
#> reading C:/Users/schuch/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpKU9eYr/temp_libpath4b5c4183409d/hackWRF/extdata/sample.csv 
row.names(sample) <- c("Americana","Campinas","Congonhas")

stations <- readRDS(paste0(system.file("extdata",package="hackWRF"),"/stations.Rds"))

coord    <- latlon(sample, coord = stations)
#> Americana found
#> Campinas found
#> Congonhas found
print(coord)
#>                      coordinates   n     Obs      Sim         r       IOA  FA2
#> Americana     (-47.348, -22.725) 100 51.1293 50.50000 0.9988545 0.9745851 0.98
#> Campinas  (-47.11928, -22.94673) 100 51.1293 50.74664 0.9980969 0.9703154 0.98
#> Congonhas (-46.66347, -23.61632) 100 51.1293 51.18197 0.9983078 0.9725131 0.99
#>               RMSE          MB       ME       GE  MFB....  MFE....    NMB....
#> Americana 1.542914 -0.62930054 1.279396 1.279396 23.15411 29.50468 -1.2308022
#> Campinas  1.836959 -0.38265939 1.494334 1.494334 23.95354 33.15789 -0.7484151
#> Congonhas 1.709859  0.05266833 1.383703 1.383703 12.42144 16.40495  0.1030101

#> Campinas  2.922657 -22.94673 -47.11928
